The '''Southwest Regional Tech Fair's Minecraft Tournament''' is an annual esports competition hosted by [[Southwest Regional Tech Fair]]. Running for at least four years, the contest is dedicated to the video game ''[[Minecraft]]''. Winners are gifted a cash prize, intended to be donated to an organization of choice.

== Layout ==
{{Empty section}}

== Culture ==
{{Expand section}}The tournament is a varied competition set within ''Minecraft'', with the rules and focus fluctuating every year. Some iterations focus on [[Survival mode]], while others use [[Creative]].

== Biography ==
{{Expand section}}
Approximately three years prior to the events of [[The Tournament|''The Tournament'']], the tournament was established.

On a whim, passionate ''Minecraft'' player [[Jett Warner]] decided to enlist in the contest. It had already been considered a big deal by his teacher [[Mr. Alarez]], who was confident he could stand a chance. To convince him, he enlisted Jett's [[Dri Warner|sister]] to "harass [him]" until he handed over some of his gameplay. After submitting, he quickly forgot about it, but as fate would have it managed to secure a place months later. Once he finds out he decided to begin researching the tournament, and was surprised to find it not promoted on social media.
